name: hamburg
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large city in the northwestern part of Germany: Defeat for her party could be compounded should it lose again in Hamburg city state elections at the end of February. In 1985, a German government scholarship took her to Hamburg to study with Ligeti.
More examplesFewer examplesWe arrived in Hamburg the following morning.He lives in a small town 20 miles from Hamburg.Germany's big cities came under heavy attack, notably Hamburg, where 77 percent of the buildings lay in ruins.
